original_title: Vibrancy in banking and financial sector counters elevating fortunes of bourse
original_body_lines: The stock market yesterday too continued on its bullish trend indicating that banking and financial sector counters are performing well. This is so because after the external debt restructuring process is concluded in November, the government could issue new sovereign bonds, replacing the previous/existing default bonds, thereby benefiting the local banking sector, market analysts said.

Following the conclusion of the external debt restructuring process in November, the local banking and financial sector is likely to get better options than other foreign banks in the sovereign bond issue exercise, thus resulting in attracting both, local and foreign investors, to those stocks, analysts said.

Amid those developments both indices moved upwards. The All Share Price Index went up by 135.5 points, while the S and P SL20 rose by 68.8 points. Turnover stood at Rs 3.96 billion with seven crossings.

HNB crossed 436,000 shares to the tune of Rs 96.7 million, its shares traded at Rs 222, Commercial Bank 680,000 shares crossed for Rs 78.1 million; its shares traded at Rs 115.50, LB Finance 1 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 74 million; its shares traded at Rs 74, Sampath Bank 750,000 shares crossed for Rs 65 million; its shares traded at Rs 87, CIC Holdings (Non Voting) 892,000 shares crossed for Rs 53.5 million; it’s shares sold at Rs 60, Seylan Bank 965,000 shares crossed for Rs 51 million; its shares traded at Rs 52.80, Sunshine Holdings 500,000 shares crossed for Rs 33.5 million and its shares traded at Rs 67 and ACL Cables 246,000 shares crossed for Rs 22.5 million; its shares sold at Rs 91.50.

In the retail market top seven companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; HNB Rs 295 million (1.3 million shares traded), Sampath Bank Rs 246 million (2.8 million shares traded), Lanka IOC Rs 232 million (2 million shares traded), CIC Rs 181 million (2.2 million shares traded), Commercial Bank Rs 177 million (1.5 million shares traded), NDB Rs 176 million (2.1 million shares traded) and Lankem Development Rs 112 million (5.2 million shares traded). During the day 115 million share volumes changed hands in 22852 transactions.
It is said that the banking and financial sector was the main contributor to the turnover, while the manufacturing sector became the second largest contributor to the market.
Yesterday the rupee depreciated slightly to open at Rs 293.70/75 to the US dollar from Rs 293.60/70 a day earlier, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said.

A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted at 10.60/80 percent, up from 10.55/75 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2027 was quoted stable at 11.45/50 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2028 was quoted at 11.70/75 percent, up from 11.65/75 percent. A bond maturing on 15.09.2029 was quoted at 11.95/12.05 percent, down from 11.95/12.10 percent.
